schedulers.name: scx_bpfland
schedulers.description: A vruntime-based sched_ext scheduler that prioritizes interactive workloads by detecting tasks with high voluntary context switch rates. Tasks are categorized as interactive or regular based on their average rate of voluntary context switches per second. Interactive tasks are prioritized in a higher-priority queue with weighted runtime scheduling. Each task gets a time slice budget that carries over unused portions, benefiting latency-sensitive workloads like real-time audio.
schedulers.characteristics: interactive task prioritization, voluntary context switch detection, weighted runtime queuing, time slice budget carryover, cpu frequency control, cache topology awareness

slice_us.description: Maximum scheduling slice duration in microseconds

slice_us_min.description: Minimum scheduling slice duration in microseconds

slice_us_lag.description: Maximum time slice lag in microseconds

idle_resume_us.description: CPU idle QoS resume latency in microseconds

no_wake_sync.description: Disable direct dispatch during synchronous wakeups

schedulers.limitations: May not optimize for pure batch workloads, experimental kthread prioritization
schedulers.performance_profile: optimized for low latency and interactive responsiveness

schedulers.name: scx_central
schedulers.description: A central scheduler where all scheduling decisions are made from a single CPU, allowing other cores to run with infinite slices without timer ticks. This design reduces scheduling overhead by concentrating all scheduling logic on one designated CPU while worker CPUs simply execute tasks. Tasks are preempted every 20ms via timer callback.
schedulers.characteristics: single cpu dispatch, infinite slices, timer tick reduction, fifo ordering, 20ms preemption timer

central_cpu.description: CPU ID to use for central scheduling

schedulers.limitations: Not production ready, no priority mechanism, fixed 20ms preemption
schedulers.performance_profile: reduced scheduling overhead on worker CPUs

schedulers.name: scx_chaos
schedulers.description: A chaos testing scheduler based on scx_p2dq that introduces controlled randomness to stress test scheduling behavior and identify race conditions. Designed to amplify race conditions and test system stability under adverse scheduling conditions.
schedulers.characteristics: chaos injection, random delays, performance degradation, cpu frequency manipulation, kprobe-based delays

random_delay_frequency.description: Chance of randomly delaying a process

random_delay_min_us.description: Minimum time to add for random delay

random_delay_max_us.description: Maximum time to add for random delay

schedulers.limitations: Not production ready, intentionally unpredictable performance
schedulers.performance_profile: designed for stress testing, not performance

schedulers.name: scx_flash
schedulers.description: An EDF (Earliest Deadline First) scheduler that assigns dynamic latency weights based on CPU usage patterns. Tasks that release CPU early receive higher latency weights, prioritizing them over tasks that consume full time slices. Deadlines are calculated as vruntime + exec_vruntime, ensuring fairness while prioritizing latency-sensitive tasks.
schedulers.characteristics: dynamic latency weights, early cpu release priority, fairness focused, vruntime tracking, exec_vruntime accounting, voluntary context switch credits

slice_us_lag.description: Maximum runtime budget accumulation while sleeping

run_us_lag.description: Maximum runtime penalty accumulation while running

max_avg_nvcsw.description: Maximum rate of voluntary context switches

cpu_busy_thresh.description: CPU utilization threshold for busy detection (-1 = auto)

throttle_us.description: Throttle the running CPUs by periodically injecting idle cycles

idle_resume_us.description: Set CPU idle QoS resume latency in microseconds (-1 = disabled)

no_wake_sync.description: Disable direct dispatch during synchronous wakeups

primary_domain.description: Specifies the initial set of CPUs (auto/performance/powersave/all/none or hex bitmask)

cpufreq.description: Enable CPU frequency control with schedutil governor

schedulers.limitations: May not optimize for pure throughput, complex latency weight tuning
schedulers.performance_profile: optimized for low latency and predictable performance

schedulers.name: scx_flatcg
schedulers.description: A high-performance cgroup-aware scheduler that flattens the cgroup hierarchy for better performance. It implements hierarchical weight-based cgroup CPU control by compounding active weight shares at each level into a single flat structure, eliminating tree traversal overhead during scheduling decisions.
schedulers.characteristics: cgroup hierarchy flattening, weight compounding, performance optimization, dual mode operation (vtime/fifo), low scheduling overhead

fifo.description: Use FIFO scheduling instead of weighted vtime

schedulers.limitations: Limited to cgroup use cases, thundering herd issues possible
schedulers.performance_profile: optimized for low overhead cgroup scheduling

schedulers.name: scx_lavd
schedulers.description: A sophisticated latency-aware scheduler implementing LAVD (Latency-criticality Aware Virtual Deadline) algorithm. It measures task latency criticality and uses virtual deadline scheduling with per-LLC domains, core type awareness, and NUMA awareness. Designed for gaming and interactive workloads on single CCX/socket systems.
schedulers.characteristics: latency criticality measurement, virtual deadline scheduling, per llc domains, core type awareness, numa awareness, autopilot mode, power profile integration

autopilot.description: Automatically decide power mode and CPU preferences

autopower.description: Automatically decide power mode based on system's active power profile

cpu_pref_order.description: List of CPUs in preferred order (e.g., 0-3,7,6,5,4)

no_use_em.description: Do not use the energy model in making CPU preference order decisions

no_wake_sync.description: Disable an optimization for synchronous wake-up

schedulers.limitations: Complex configuration, mainly targets single CCX/socket systems
schedulers.performance_profile: optimized for low latency and interactivity

schedulers.name: scx_layered
schedulers.description: A highly configurable multi-layer scheduler that allows creating custom layers with different scheduling policies. Tasks are classified into layers based on matches (cgroup, comm, nice, etc.) and each layer can have different policies (Confined, Grouped, Open) with specific CPU utilization guarantees and topology awareness.
schedulers.characteristics: task classification, multiple scheduling policies, cpu utilization guarantees, topology awareness, performance control, numa node affinity, llc affinity, dynamic layer sizing

no_load_frac_limit.description: Disable load-fraction based max layer CPU limit

lo_fb_wait_us.description: Low priority fallback DSQ wait time in microseconds

lo_fb_share.description: Fraction of CPU time low priority fallback DSQs can utilize

gpu_affinitize_secs.description: GPU task reaffinitization interval in seconds

layer_refresh_ms_avgruntime.description: Period for AvgRuntime reevaluation in milliseconds

schedulers.limitations: Complex configuration required, potential infeasible weights issue
schedulers.performance_profile: highly customizable based on layer configuration

schedulers.name: scx_mitosis
schedulers.description: A dynamic affinity scheduler implementing cell-based scheduling architecture. Dynamically assigns cgroups to 'cells' which are mapped to specific CPU sets. Cells can be merged or split based on system conditions, with vtime-based scheduling within each cell.
schedulers.characteristics: dynamic cell management, adaptive cpu assignment, cgroup awareness, vtime scheduling, numa awareness, cell splitting/merging

rebalance_cpus_interval_s.description: Interval to rebalance CPUs to cells

schedulers.limitations: Experimental scheduler, not production ready
schedulers.performance_profile: experimental dynamic affinity management

schedulers.name: scx_nest
schedulers.description: A frequency-optimized scheduler that keeps tasks on warm cores to maintain high CPU frequencies. Based on the Inria-Paris Nest paper, it divides cores into primary and reserve nests, concentrating work on a subset of cores to maximize boost frequencies. Best suited for single CCX/socket systems with low to moderate CPU utilization.
schedulers.characteristics: warm core prioritization, frequency optimization, single ccx limitation, cache locality awareness, dynamic nest sizing, hyperthreading awareness

delay_us.description: Delay before removing idle core from primary nest

r_max.description: Maximum number of cores in reserve nest

prefer_idle.description: Prefer fully idle cores over siblings

schedulers.limitations: Limited to single CCX, not good for high CPU utilization
schedulers.performance_profile: optimized for frequency boost and power efficiency

schedulers.name: scx_p2dq
schedulers.description: A versatile scheduler with multi-layer queuing using pick-two load balancing. Implements slice-based task classification to automatically detect interactive vs batch tasks. Features configurable time slices and load balancing across LLC domains with interactive task prioritization.
schedulers.characteristics: multi layer queuing, slice based classification, interactive detection, load balancing across llc, configurable time slices, pick two algorithm

interactive_ratio.description: Ratio of interactive to batch tasks

schedulers.limitations: May need tuning for specific workloads, complex queue management
schedulers.performance_profile: balanced for mixed workloads

schedulers.name: scx_pair
schedulers.description: A sibling scheduler ensuring tasks only co-locate on a physical core if they're in the same cgroup. Demonstrates how to implement security mitigations for CPU bugs like L1TF by enforcing strict cgroup isolation on SMT siblings. Uses scx_bpf_kick_cpu() to preempt siblings when constraints are violated.
schedulers.characteristics: strict cgroup isolation, smt aware scheduling, cpu sibling pairing, security focused, educational demonstration
schedulers.limitations: Not production ready, demonstration scheduler only
schedulers.performance_profile: security focused, not performance optimized

schedulers.name: scx_prev
schedulers.description: A variation on scx_simple that prioritizes selecting an idle previous CPU over finding fully idle cores. This optimization leverages CPU cache locality by preferring the previous CPU when possible, reducing cache misses. Particularly effective for OLTP workloads on simple topology systems.
schedulers.characteristics: previous cpu priority, cache locality optimization, simple and efficient, statistics tracking

interval.description: Sampling interval for statistics in seconds

schedulers.limitations: Not extensively tested in production, best for simple topology
schedulers.performance_profile: optimized for cache locality

schedulers.name: scx_qmap
schedulers.description: A simple five-level FIFO queue scheduler demonstrating fundamental sched_ext features. Tasks are distributed across five priority queues based on their compound weight, with weighted dispatch giving more opportunities to higher priority queues. Includes core scheduling support and CPU performance scaling.
schedulers.characteristics: five level priority queuing, weighted dispatch, sleepable task storage, core scheduling support, cpu performance scaling, bpf map demonstration

batch_count.description: Dispatch up to COUNT tasks together

schedulers.limitations: Not production ready, simplified design for demonstration
schedulers.performance_profile: demonstration scheduler, not optimized

schedulers.name: scx_rlfifo
schedulers.description: A simple Round-Robin scheduler running in user-space based on scx_rustland_core framework. Dequeues tasks in FIFO order and assigns dynamic time slices to achieve basic Round-Robin behavior. Provided as a template for testing more complex scheduling policies.
schedulers.characteristics: user space scheduling, fifo ordering, dynamic time slices, rustland core based, simple template
schedulers.limitations: Not production ready, use kernel SCHED_FIFO for real-time needs
schedulers.performance_profile: basic round-robin, not performance optimized

schedulers.name: scx_rustland
schedulers.description: A user-space scheduler written in Rust that prioritizes interactive workloads. Scheduling decisions are made entirely in user-space using a deadline-based algorithm (vruntime + exec_runtime). Tasks are stored in a BTreeSet and dispatched from lowest to highest deadline, favoring latency-sensitive tasks that frequently sleep.
schedulers.characteristics: full user space implementation, deadline based ordering, vruntime tracking, exec runtime accounting, interactive prioritization, rust implementation
schedulers.limitations: User-space overhead, not ideal for performance-critical scenarios
schedulers.performance_profile: optimized for interactivity over raw performance

schedulers.name: scx_rusty
schedulers.description: A production-ready multi-domain scheduler with intelligent load balancing. Creates separate scheduling domains per LLC with user-space load balancing. Features configurable thresholds, greedy task stealing, and support for both FIFO and priority-based scheduling within domains. Architecture-flexible design suitable for various CPU topologies.
schedulers.characteristics: multi domain support, per llc domains, user space load balancing, configurable thresholds, architecture flexibility, greedy task stealing, fifo mode support

slice_us_underutil.description: Scheduling slice duration for under-utilized hosts, in microseconds

slice_us_overutil.description: Scheduling slice duration for over-utilized hosts, in microseconds

tune_interval.description: The tuner runs at a higher frequency than the load balancer to dynamically tune scheduling behavior. Tuning interval in seconds

load_half_life.description: The half-life of task and domain load running averages in seconds

cache_level.description: Build domains according to how CPUs are grouped at this cache level

cpumasks.description: Manually set the cpumask for each domain (e.g., 0xff_00ff). Each CPU must belong to precisely one domain

greedy_threshold.description: When non-zero, enable greedy task stealing. Minimum tasks in a domain before stealing is allowed

greedy_threshold_x_numa.description: When non-zero, enable greedy task stealing across NUMA nodes

kthreads_local.description: If disabled, kthreads are scheduled like any other task. If enabled, they're scheduled within the same domain as waker and wakee

balanced_kworkers.description: Distribute workers like kworkers across domains evenly

fifo_sched.description: Use FIFO scheduling within domains instead of DSQ weights

direct_greedy_under.description: When system util below this, tasks are directly dispatched even if this violates domain boundaries

kick_greedy_under.description: Greedy threshold delta below which other domains won't be kicked

direct_greedy_numa.description: Allow direct greedy stealing across NUMA boundaries

partial.description: Skip BPF scheduling for userspace programs with pid < 1000

perf.description: Tunable for prioritizing CPU performance by configuring the CPU frequency governor. Valid values are [0, 1024]. Higher values prioritize performance

schedulers.limitations: May not distinguish NUMA nodes well, potential infeasible weights issue
schedulers.performance_profile: balanced general-purpose performance

schedulers.name: scx_sdt
schedulers.description: A simple demonstration scheduler showcasing BPF arena usage for per-task data management. Implements basic FIFO scheduling while tracking detailed statistics about task lifecycle and scheduling decisions using the BPF arena allocator system.
schedulers.characteristics: bpf arena demonstration, per task data management, statistics collection, simple fifo scheduling, arena allocation showcase
schedulers.limitations: Educational scheduler only, minimal scheduling logic
schedulers.performance_profile: demonstration scheduler, not performance focused

schedulers.name: scx_simple
schedulers.description: A simple scheduler with minimal complexity supporting both weighted vtime and FIFO modes. Optimized for single socket systems with uniform L3 cache. Provides a straightforward scheduling implementation suitable for systems where simplicity is preferred over advanced features.
schedulers.characteristics: dual mode operation, minimal complexity, single socket optimized, starvation risk in fifo, straightforward implementation

fifo.description: Use FIFO mode instead of vtime

schedulers.limitations: Limited scalability, may not optimize complex workloads
schedulers.performance_profile: simple and predictable performance

schedulers.name: scx_tickless
schedulers.description: An experimental server-oriented scheduler designed to reduce OS noise by minimizing timer ticks. Routes all scheduling events through a pool of primary CPUs, allowing other CPUs to run tickless. Requires kernel booted with nohz_full for full effectiveness. Designed for cloud computing, virtualization, and HPC workloads.
schedulers.characteristics: tick reduction, primary cpu pool, os noise reduction, global task queue, configurable frequency, nohz full requirement, ipc based preemption

primary_domain.description: CPU mask for primary scheduling CPUs (hex)

prefer_same_cpu.description: Try to keep tasks on same CPU

schedulers.limitations: Not production ready, experimental, syscall overhead with nohz_full
schedulers.performance_profile: optimized for reduced OS noise, not latency

schedulers.name: scx_userland
schedulers.description: A fully user-space scheduler for educational purposes demonstrating user-space scheduling concepts. All scheduling decisions are made in user-space with an ordered list scheduling approach. While offering development advantages, it has inherent performance overhead and deadlock risks.
schedulers.characteristics: full user space implementation, ordered list scheduling, development advantages, deadlock risk, performance overhead, educational focus
schedulers.limitations: Not production ready, performance overhead, potential deadlocks
schedulers.performance_profile: educational scheduler with significant overhead
